page.title: 08Education
page.content: Most children go to three schools between 5 and 16 or 18. The children at Alban Middle School at Great Barford first went to a Lower School - some of these are very small because less children are being born. Some Lower Schools, like Tempsford School have recently closed or may do so in the future. Some people say once a school is too small it is too expensive to run. Most children travel by coach from smaller villages like Renhold, Roxton, Ravensden, Mogerhanger, Wilden and Colmworth each day to Alban School. At present there are about 370 at Alban. Middle Schools take pupils from age 9 to 13. Then they go to an Upper School - either in Bedford or Sandy until they leave.
